RangeStartOffset.summary:
The Range.startOffset read-only property returns a number
representing where in the startContainer the Range starts.

remarks.para:
If the startContainer is a of type
, , or , then the
offset is the number of characters from the start of the startContainer to
the boundary point of the . For other types, the
startOffset is the number of child nodes between the start of the
startContainer and the boundary point of the .

To change the startOffset of a , use the
method.
